unnormalised: **EV Charging Gets a Festive Boost Ahead of Onam!**
normalised: **Electric Vehicle Charging Gets a Festive Boost Ahead of Onam!**

unnormalised: Bangalore: Looks like getting your EV juiced up is about to get easier, just in time for the Onam celebrations! Ather Energy just announced they're rolling out 50 new fast-charging points across Kerala this month. That means less range anxiety when you're driving home to Amma's and more time enjoying that delicious Onam Sadhya.
normalised: Bangalore: Looks like getting your electric vehicle juiced up is about to get easier, just in time for the Onam celebrations! Ather Energy just announced they are rolling out fifty new fast-charging points across Kerala this month. That means less range anxiety when you are driving home to Amma's and more time enjoying that delicious Onam Sadhya.

unnormalised: Tata Motors is also getting in on the action. Word on the street is they're teaming up with Bharat Petroleum to set up charging stations along major highways connecting Chennai and Bangalore. Imagine stopping for a biryani break and a quick charge!
normalised: Tata Motors is also getting in on the action. Word on the street is they are teaming up with Bharat Petroleum to set up charging stations along major highways connecting Chennai and Bangalore. Imagine stopping for a biryani break and a quick charge!

unnormalised: Experts at IIT Madras are even working on developing more efficient and cheaper charging tech using locally sourced materials. Think "Make in India" for EV charging! Early tests suggest we could see a significant reduction in charging times and costs, maybe even under Rs. 5 per km. This could seriously boost EV adoption, especially for folks planning those long road trips. Now thatâ€™s what we call progress! Drive safe and happy Onam!
normalised: Experts at I I T Madras are even working on developing more efficient and cheaper charging tech using locally sourced materials. Think "Make in India" for Electric Vehicle charging! Early tests suggest we could see a significant reduction in charging times and costs, maybe even under rupee five per kilometer. This could seriously boost Electric Vehicle adoption, especially for folks planning those long road trips. Now that is what we call progress! Drive safe and happy Onam!
